er, the
>second class should use a mockobject version of the classpathwalke=
r. 
>ClasspathWalker should be an interface.  This way you can test your ow=
n
>reaction to fake events.  Ones which you control and aren't dependent on=

>the classpath walker OR ON THE CLASSES IN THE PATH.

This is where I disa=
gree with the use of mocks. I have to thank you, David, for putting this ex=
ample in the spotlight.

The second test may be better if it depends on the=
 data from the classpath walker, rather than a mock classpath walker. Presu=
mably the mock classpath walker will be implemented to hardcode specified c=
lasspath walking data, anyway. I propose to extract the classpath walking d=
ata, then, and pass it to the second object, rather than mocking a classpat=
h walker.

Thoughts?

PS: If you do this, then the tests become 100% isolat=
ed as a side effect of avoiding extra code.
